Articles.Content:
<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/grGEYjTawM8?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

Something that happens with everybody in Kerbal Space Program at some point, just happened in real life with the Progress M module that was supposed to bring stuff to the astronauts on the ISS.

> 
> <iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/grGEYjTawM8?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>
> 
> Something that happens with everybody in Kerbal Space Program at some point[...]

It never happened to me.

I just decide to turn my docking into a "rotation stress test". the fact that the craft start rotating before the decision was made just mean that whoever is in control of the craft is so smart that he can foresee the decisions ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

> 
> It never happened to me.
> the fact that the craft start rotating before the decision was made just mean that whoever is in control of the craft is so smart that he can foresee the decisions ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

***Ã¢â‚¬â€¹lol.***
Where the overpowered SAS when we need it?

They seem to have implemented this into the game.

Half my probes are experiencing random rotation... in the middle of space... with SAS turned off... ![:confused:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_huh.gif)
